text.front:
Eventually-Serializable
Data Services
Alan
Fekete*
David
Guptat
Victor
Luchangcot
Nancy
Lyncht
Alex Shvartsmant
Abstract
We present
a new specification
for distributed
data ser-
vices that
trade-off
immediate
consistency guarantees
for improved
system
availability
and efficiency, while
ensuring
the long-term
consistency
of the data. An
eventually-serializable
data service maintains
the oper-
ations
requested
in a partial
order that gravitates over
time towards
a total
order.
It provides
clear and unam-
biguous
guarantees
about
the immediate
and long-term
behavior
of the system.
To demonstrate
its utility, we
present
an algorithm,
based on one of Ladin,
Liskov,
Shrira,
and Ghemawat
[12], that implements
this spec-
ification.
Our algorithm
provides
the interface
of the
abstract
service,
and generalizes
their
algorithm
by al-
lowing
general
operations
and greater
flexibility
in spec-
ifying
consistency
requirements.
We also describe how
to use this specification
as a building
block for applica-
tions such as directory
services.
